Package app

Class CollisionChecker

java.lang.Object
app.CollisionChecker
public class CollisionChecker extends Object
This class is used to check collisions between entities and objects
Author:
Long Nguyen (dln3), Andrew Hein (ach17)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CollisionChecker(GamePanel gp)
    Constructs a new CollisionChecker object and links it to a TileManager singleton.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    checkEntityCollision(Entity entity, Farmer[] farmers)
    Checks if entity will collide with any of the farmers in the array (the only enemies on the map currently) If collision will happen, turns on their collisionOn variable to stop movement and returns index of farmer collided with Checked by temporarily moving entities hitbox in the direction it is moving and seeing if collision happens All of these check_____Collision() functions are very similar just for specific scenarios
    int
    checkObjectCollision(Entity entity, boolean player)
    If the farmer interacts with an object, do nothing.
    void
    checkPlayerCollision(Entity entity)
    Checks if entity is colliding with the player by checking if on its next movement its hitbox will intersect with players Always called by entities other than the player character
    void
    checkTileCollision(Entity entity)
    Checking the 2 tiles ahead for collision

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • checkTileCollision

      public void checkTileCollision(Entity entity)
      Checking the 2 tiles ahead for collision
      Parameters:
      entity -

    • checkObjectCollision

      public int checkObjectCollision(Entity entity, boolean player)
      If the farmer interacts with an object, do nothing. If the player interacts with an object, find the index and return it so the proper interaction can happen
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity that will collide with the object
      player - The player character
      Returns:
      returns the index of the object interacted with

    • checkEntityCollision

      public int checkEntityCollision(Entity entity, Farmer[] farmers)
      Checks if entity will collide with any of the farmers in the array (the only enemies on the map currently) If collision will happen, turns on their collisionOn variable to stop movement and returns index of farmer collided with Checked by temporarily moving entities hitbox in the direction it is moving and seeing if collision happens All of these check_____Collision() functions are very similar just for specific scenarios
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity that is calling this function to check if it will collide with an entity on next movement
      farmers - the array of entities (currently farmers only) to check for possible collisions with
      Returns:
      index of the farmer entity collided with

    • checkPlayerCollision

      public void checkPlayerCollision(Entity entity)
      Checks if entity is colliding with the player by checking if on its next movement its hitbox will intersect with players Always called by entities other than the player character
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity (currently always farmer) that may collide with the player during movement
